Ithaca is home to one of the worlds most successful local currency experiments. The Ithaca Hour is Ithacas local currency and is accepted by more than 600 local merchants and service providers. Using Ithaca Hours contributes to Ithacas economy and small businesses. The Autumn Leaves bookstore at Ithaca Commons serves as the unofficial home of Ithacas local currency and is the best place to go to acquire Hours. Of course, U.S. dollars are also used in Ithaca. Shopping in Ithaca is in four major areas: Downtown/Commons, Meadow Street/Route 13, Collegetown, and Lansing/Mall area. Downtown/Commons - The most typical Ithaca items can be bought downtown in the commons area. Local crafts are of exceptional quality. Ubiquitous green "Ithaca is Gorges" t-shirts can be bought here as well. Meadow Street/Route 13 - Also known as The Strip. The "big-box" stores have been moving in in a major way in recent years along Meadow St. Drugstores, cellphone stores, supermarkets, and major discount retailers are often present in multiple incarnations. There is not much exciting here for the out-of-towner although it is certainly practical. An exception is Northside Liquors (see the Drink section). Collegetown, just across Cascadilla Gorge from the Cornell campus, is mostly home to restaurants and businesses catering to the college crowd, and there are several shops specializing in Cornell- and Ithaca-related merchandise. Lansing/Mall - Finally, just north of Ithaca in Lansing is the Shops at Ithaca Mall (formerly known as the Pyramid Mall), recently expanded to hold Borders (now closing), Best Buy, Dicks Sporting Goods, and Target, offering a fairly broad and ubiquitous selection of shops. Nearby are the Triphammer and Cayuga malls, which are less elaborate.

Between 9th and Front Streets, holds a plethora of bargain stores and unique boutiques with a distinct urban Philadelphia flair. Retro Vintage, Guacamole and Condom Kingdom are among the most popular stores amidst a large amount of restaurants and bars.
The visitor center features a bookstore and gift shop.

Antique Row Pine street between 9th and 13th is home to a mix of antique stores and local gift and craft boutiques. Visit the Foodery at 10th and Pine for a selection of hundreds of by-the-bottle beers from around the world, or a few blocks down, ring the bell at Halloween (1329 Pine) for an incredible jewelry store experience that can accommodate any budget.

This small, privately-owned store is a favorite jewelry store among many locals. All repairs are done on site, right in front of you, and their friendly service will help you make all the right decisions when finding that perfect piece of jewelry. Notable for having many sterling silver items, they also carry gold items and they even let you design your own jewelry.
Handcrafted wood gifts, in Western, horse, Native American arts, and wildlife themes.
Great thrift and vintage store. All proceeds go to support the Aids Action Committee, New England’s first and largest AIDS service organization. Always a good selection of clothing and furniture.
Open since the 1950’s, AD Appliance Center is a family-owned discount appliance store.

Dearborn. Remodeled in 2007. 15 minutes from Metro Airport and downtown Detroit, this large mall features more urban fashion and discount retailers with about 150 stores, popular restaurants including a P.F Chang and an Andiamos. Adult supervision of those under 18 is required after 5:00 PM by someone who is at least 21.
Year round shop offering a decent variety of skis, snowboards, and snow gear. Rentals are available.
This old fashion candy shop has the best chocolate around. They make homemade chocolate with molds for every occasion.
A great traditional geek store - board games, Magic, Munchkin! A great place. Although very lifeless when I was there, it seems like it has tourneys and DD sessions.
Downtown on the E Main Street
An amazing array of cigars, chess, and game sets. A small selection of "old fashioned" razors and jewelry is also available.

This large shopping center is located in the Ridgeway neighborhood of Stamford. Close proximity to downtown with a large selection of shopping including clothing, electronics, furniture and groceries. Also in the center is a Party City, a Bed, Bath Beyond and an Emack and Bolio’s (a popular ice cream chain) is located on the Summer street side. Two levels of free parking lots as well as meter parking spots on Summer Street.
Head north on Atlantic Street off Exit 7 and continue until it turns into Bedford Street. Shopping Center has large sign and will be on your left.
Hudson has a huge number of art galleries and antique stores for a town of its size as well as fashion, fabric, and other craft studios.
This flower shop is open year round and offers a vast array of flowers as well as gardening equipment to purchase. Buy local!
Mon-Fri: 10am to 7pm, Sat and Sun: 10am to 6pm

Project Pauls thrift shop is staffed by volunteers. Proceeds from sales go to support their programs. Clothing, household items, and other necessities from the thrift store are also donated to qualifying families.

Pipestem Creek 9 miles south on Highway 281, 1 mile east on Highway 9, Carrington. Manufacturer of hand-made SunFlorals (exquisite natural floral wreaths) and SunFeeders (edible birdfeeders and birdhouses). Summer tours include extensive gardens, drying and production facilities and gift shop. There are three renovated granaries and a train depot. There is a gift shop in a restored 10-sided granary. Open year-round, Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM, and they have extended hours in the summer and fall. Open evenings and weekends by appointment. Guided tours welcome by reservation. Tel: (701) 652-2623. Fax: (701) 652-1441. Email: pipestem@daktel.com
If you want to see Berea and its artists up close and personal, go downtown and just walk the streets. Many artisans have workshops there, and are open to the public (typically 9AM-5PM).
Trenton , just outside of Ellsworth, on the way to the airport, Acadia National Park and Bar Harbor, . Maine jams, etc.
Toys for the Fun of It
Great educational toy store with all kinds of neat finds. There should be more kids stores just like this one.
Where you want to go for all of the latest in music. The store is massive and carries an expansive selection of music.
A very cute shop with unique finds such as art pieces, jewelry, and assorted bandages in a wide array of shapes (including beef and bacon). Definitely worth stopping in.

Trendy restaurants brush shoulders with coffeeshops and Mom Pop grocery stores along Tremont Street and its side streets all the way down to Washington Street (link to Wash. Main Streets), which is experiencing an artistic revival - a significant number of artists are moving in, and galleries are cropping up around the area to show their works.
An art gallery with unique artworks all by local artists.v
NewPark Mall is a large enclosed mall that features Macys, Target, JC Penney, Sears, and Mervyns. Rarely ever crowded.

The Country Club Mall is the only indoor shopping mall in at least a 70-mile radius of Cumberland. It is in suburban La Vale , which is about 5 minutes driving time from downtown. Anchor stores include JC Penney, Sears, The Bon-Ton, and Walmart Supercenter.
Offers unique hand-crafted custom clothing and accessories.
W-M. Mens work and leisure clothing and accessories, and cigars.
Rons Tackle Box/The Old Anglers Antique Gallerie
Bait tackle shop that also offers collectible knives, trophy fish/game mounts, and specialized outdoorsman-type gifts.
Corner of NB U.S. 17/92 E Cumming St.
136 Courthouse Square (on the Square), +1 662 281-1197. Fine shoes, cosmetics, apparel, and accessories.
Very large store. Located on Route Two. The store offers a variety of things to buy such as clothes, jewelry, accessories, food, electronics, houseware, and more.
Moravian Book Shop is the oldest bookstore in the country, open since 1745. They sell mostly books, but also souvenirs and Moravian stars, which are popular during the Christmas season.
Celebrations (Wedding Invitations). Offers a line of personalized accessories and invitations for wedding receptions. (217) 762-325
Vacaville Premium Outlets. A popular outlet mall.
Watch Sam demonstrate the ancient art of glassblowing and enjoy Dis pottery made in Ouray. Made-in-Ouray artwork.
The charming old town square of Decatur has many antique shops and other quaint little stores and cafés.
Fresh citrus. Plaquemines has long been famous in this region for the great oranges, satsumas, and other citrus fruit grown here. There are several stands and shops along the highways.
Independent shop, nice and cozy, has a wide selection, and has interesting staff recommendations glued to the book stalls. Used and remaindered books are located downstairs.
Beach wear and clothing for all ages, including board shorts, t-shirts, foot wear, sunglasses, bathing suits, and beach accessories.
+1 734 426–0571. Decorated glassware, jewelry, dolls, stuffed animals, toys, candles, gifts, and home accents.
There are maps, books for sale at the visitor centers. There you can also buy bundles of T-shirts and baseball caps with the Park logo and a range of souvenirs of the area.
Unique furnishings, accessories, original art, and custom kitchen cabinetry.

For those who are looking for that fine cigar, Cigar Box Ltd. is the place for you. They offer a wide selection of some of the best cigars. Nothing beats a good cigar for those backyard BBQs, fishing out on the boat, or relaxing in the sun.

Features emerging and mid-career contemporary artists. MRCA is the first gallery on the peninsula to introduce original, high-quality artwork at a range of prices that makes art affordable to everyone. Openings every 6 weeks on Saturday evenings from 7 to 9pm. Located one block from the Fox Theater.

Inspired by magazines and catalogs such as Country Living and Ballard Designs. I try to find similar products for my customers at a much lower price. Find special savings on Facebook, Yelp and Foursquare.

Freighthouse Square is a building three city blocks long, with shops and eating places inside, near the Tacoma Dome. Open M-Sa from 10AM-7PM and Sunday from noon to 5PM The Tacoma Mall , near Interstate 5 (at the 38th Street exit) is a major shopping center in Tacoma. A wide variety of stores extending well to the north and south of the mall, as well.
In the Northwest part of the county. Another Westfield Shopping Town.
The result of a decade-long urban renewal effort in midtown Omaha. This development provides shopping space, dining, contemporary condominiums and apartments in a single location.
For more shopping in the area, check out the Allentown and Bethlehem (Pennsylvania) pages.
Progressively old fashioned gifts, jewelry, collectibles. Local arts, local crafts.
2116 Main Street, Suite D, P.O. Box 1447, Julian, CA 92036
Jenkinsons Sweet Shop-located on Jenkinsons Boardwalk-This small shop offers a variety of tempting treats like Salt Water Taffy, Caramel and Candy Apples and Homemade Fudge
Gas station, Money orders, Western Union
Open daily. A gift and home-furnishings store located in three renovated buildings, offering country crafts, costume jewellery, pottery and handpainted items.

The sales tax rate in the city is 9.50%. The Albany Farmers market on Solano at San Pablo takes place every Wednesday from 3:00 - 7:00 pm between May and October. Its a small market, but features coveted vendors from the other year-round farmers markets in the East Bay.
Vail has all your typical resort shops. The one thing that is uniquely Vail is the The Golden Bear , a jewelry store known for its line of jewelry featuring a (duh) Golden Bear.
Norwood is home to the original AutoMile on Rte 1 which houses dealerships from almost every car manufacturer in the world.

Boulder Run: Kid’s Stuff, Marshall’s, Super Stop and Shop Wyckoff Shopping Center Cedar Hill: Drugfair, Center Stage Dance Supplies There are other major shopping centers in most towns in the Northern part of Bergen County all less than twenty-five minutes by car including shops in Ho-Hokus, Ridgewood, Ramsey, Waldwick and Midland Park as well as the Garden State Plaza, Paramus Fashion Center and Bergen Town Center.
Unique hand-drawn pictures of people and pets.
Craters of the Moon National Monument
Craters of the Moon Natural History Association Bookstore
Labor Day-Memorial Day (off-season): Daily 8AM-4:30PM, closed on Federal holidays during off-season; Memorial Day-Labor Day (Summer): Daily - 8AM-6PM
It is a small shop that offers a large selection of different kinds of lamps and lamp shades. The owners David and Marie Mancini also work with and help homeowners design house lighting.
Most, if not all, of Brocktons many shoe factories and outlets are now closed.

A quirky used bookstore with books ranging from the obscure academic tomes to 50s pulp paperbacks to old Nancy Drew. Hours vary depending on the owners schedule. Its next door to Gimme Coffee so get something to read while you sip.
It contains a Macys department store, and numerous smaller shops.
Retail store located in Boulder. Purchase lift tickets, season passes and retail items on your way up to the Resort.

being at the end of the road during the winters makes Cooke City an excellent place to launch off on a snowmobile adventure. Many trails for advanced and beginner riders means snowmobiling can be a thrilling experience or just a way to tour the area in the winter.
Santa Maria Town Center is a major shopping mall in Santa Maria, located at the junction of Broadway (Route 135) and Main Street (Route 166). http://www.santamariatowncenter.com
Lafayette, Indie music store concert space. Closed
One of the top 10 outlet malls in America, Prime Outlets feature 120 stores offering 25-65% off brand name merchandise. Open daily Mo-Sa 10AM-9PM, Sun 10AM-7PM.

727 - 823 - 2000. Voted Tampa Bays Favorite Jeweler in "St. Pete Times" poll. 33 years of offering St. Petersburg estate as well as unique one-of-a-kind handmade custom jewelry. Quality repairs personalized service.
Nursery and Garden Gift Shop. Great selection of plants and gifts for the gardener. Ask for Norman or Desiree.
a lively, friendly market located on a beautiful, grassy lawn at Mike Wallace Park at the Port of Kingston Marina where local farmers, producers, crafters, and artisans sell their goods.
There is a nice book store in the rustic visitor center.
Desert Hills Premium Outlets in Cabazon
Large outlet mall with over 100 stores.
One of the largest single-story malls on the West Coast, abundant in stores.

This small little candy shop is in a little alley way in the borough of town. The store offers any candys, nuts, fudges, and sweets you can imagine! This old fashian candy shop is stocked with all of your favorite classic candies!
Sue and Jerrys Ranch Store Center
Antique shop with an open-air gallery of large metal sculptures.

An unusual array of fine quality leather goods. Outerwear, Handbags, Wallets and accessories. Best selection of Dansko Clogs, NAOT Sandals and Minnetonka Slippers. Same location for over 36 years. Established 1974.
to the left on Bearskin Neck
Point Roberts main business is selling gas (lower tax rates), dairy products and US postal services to Canadians. The post office rents far more boxes to Canadian residents than to local residents.
A quaint mall with plenty of stores for the family. The mall has two floors and creates a square shape.
A privately owned jewelry shop with an excellent selection of jewelry for women.
Specializing in high end childrens and infant clothing and accessories.
Large selection of sweets and savories. They will customize a gift box of your choices.

There are a number of strip malls, bookstores, clothing boutiques, and shopping centers in Pikesville. A relatively new and upscale shopping center, Quarry Lake at Greenspring , features a Fresh Market, Walgreens, day spa, restaurants, and stores surrounding one of the largest manmade quarry lakes in the state.
Art gallery, photography classes, prints, original sculpture, darkroom.
Custom Kitchens, Baths, and Interiors. Look to Kitchen Choreography for your new or remodeling plans in Northern Michigan.
Route 12A and Town House Rd Cornish, NH 03745
The visitors center has a small selection of books and souvenirs available.

Grocery market featuring essentials and gourmet items. Green Mountain Coffee, New Hampshire maple products, deli with Boars Head meats and cheeses, fresh baked breads, pies, breakfast pastries, wine, beer and more.
Like many small towns in the area, antiques are the only truly interesting shopping to be had.
Small but famous local general store, in operation since 1897, seven days a week, with the slogan Your Grandparents Shopped Here.
classic island book store with lots of great books, cards, and gifts. A great place for a cup of afternoon tea or the perfect place to enjoy a double espresso while staring out at the bay.
Located on Route Two. This store is great for purchasing shoes for any event. Prices range, but I would highly recommend visiting this location because sometimes there are great steals.

This store is full of many knick-knacks, for example it provides the materials for your own hemp bracelet making and many other small do it yourself gifts. The selective eye provides its shoppers with a definite unique variety in their shopping experience. Selective eye has posters, incense, jewelry, tapestries and much more all at reasonable prices.
green and fair trade products for a sustainable future, including eco-clothing for young tikes and adults, Himalayan salt lamps, body care, soy and beeswax candles, world music, etc.
less than one block from Carroll Ave; diagonally across from the gazebo

Bylers Country Store on county route 8 for some Amish homemade treats, quilts, furniture or even wood stoves. There is much genuine Amish furniture to be found in the area, too. In addition, there is an abundance of tax free shopping in Dover at the Dover Mall and various shopping centers.
Souvenir shop with Route 66 merchandise and locally-made products.

The city government has been working with local merchants for the last decade to revitalize Main Street businesses, and there are positive steps forward. Many interesting small boutiques crowd shoulder to shoulder along West Main. East Main street is still behind in the aesthetic department, but may take the cake for utility with a hardware store, electronics shop, several restaurants, and more bars than you can shake a stick at.
The Pick and Shovel is an independent hardware store turned mega-mart. You can find almost anything in this great spot--a toilet, board game, banana split, or new pet fish.
Just off of I-75 towards town
A retail mall with different architectural style buildings in a town center setting. Major tenants include Barnes Noble Booksellers, Bed Bath Beyond, Old Navy and Pier 1 Imports.

The city is not widely renowned as a shopping destination, and with good reason. Theres little to buy here that you couldnt buy elsewhere, and most (budget) shops are located in strip malls outside the city center. Gary is, however, perhaps ground zero for Michael Jackson and Jackson Five memorabilia. An easy (and, it must be said, cheesy) spot to pick up the goods is the small indoor marketplace at 487 Broadway, which also boasts a good collection of over the top celebratory Obama tees. The Market City Flea Market (4121 Cleveland St., tel. 219.887.3522) is open Friday Saturday and Sunday, 9AM-5PM. Look for the annual "Taste of Market City Carnival" July 21-25 2010.
Fabrics for quilts, garments, outerwear and home décor, plus notions, patterns and books and Pfaff sewing machines.
Hip clothing and gift boutique in the South Wedge.
Lumber store offering other services in custom doors, windows, and kitchens.

Brown Hawkins Mercantile, 907-224-3011,the local North Face, Mountain Hardware, Padagonia, Carhart outdoor wear store. Located on 4th St. in historic downtown Seward, Alaska Resurrect Art Coffee House Gallery, 320 3rd Ave., 907-224-7161. Historic Landmark. Local original art and gifts. Friendly baristas, excellent coffee. Live Jazz Tuesdays all summer. Softly Silk, 416 4th Ave., 907-224-6088, . Original Hand-painted Silks. Helly Hansen of Seward, 1304 4th Ave., 907-224-4589, . Good all weather gear for Alaskan travel. Sweet Darlings, 907-224-3011, . Alaskan Confectioners - Makers of Alaskas Finest Handmade Candies, Fudge, Chocolates, Berry Bark and Candy. Dont forget the GELATO! Made on the premises fresh daily. The Fish House/True Value Hardware, 907-224-3674, across from the small boat harbor. The place to go for local charter and fishing info, gear, tackle, etc. One giant building is split between the fish house and the hardware store. If it can be had in Seward, most likely youll find it here.
Shop the areas largest selection of quality brand-name beads, charms and everything else you need to make your own jewelry. Instruction available.
Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park

Each visitor center has a bookstore, where you can find books about the park, its physical and living features, as well as books on the history of the region. You can also shop for the same books online.

Ocean City also features outlet shopping as well as grocery and department stores to meet all your vacation needs. Of course, Ocean City has MANY souvenir shops for mementos of your Ocean City experience.
Offering tropical gifts, home decor, Island casual clothing and accessories, lighthouses, windchimes, tropical art, skin care products, candles, soap, ...
There are hundreds of shops up and down the Island, ranging in size and mainly along Long Beach Boulevard.
Their motto says it best: "The finest name in Japanese pastries since 1910."
Next to Big Sur River Inn. Shopping featuring jewelry, clothing, and collectibles.

Carytown. If you like to shop, Carytowns a must. The prices are high, but the high-end clothing, art, and antiques are worth it. Check out the restaurants while youre there - some of the best eateries in Richmond, from the low-end Galaxy Diner to the Thai restaurants, make their homes in Carytown.

Eastside Marketplace is a local grocery store owned by residents of the east side of providence. The place has fresh local meats and produce as well as organic foods. The selection of organic foods is very popular with customers. The market also serves free coffee to shoppers. Eastside Marketplace also serves hot food, which is cooked and prepared right in the store. Customers can stop in the cafe section of the store and enjoy a meal as well as buy a cup of coffee.
The other traditional Chicago retail giant opened this store in 2001. It has a few floors of moderately-priced, moderately-fashionable clothing and housewares.

Second Edition Books Music (410-730-0050) is a nifty little used book store in the same shopping center as the MVA Express. Youll find books, CDs, DVDs, and Vinyl. The Mall in Columbia off of Little Patuxent Parkway is one of the largest malls in the area and sports several higher-end department stores such as Nordstroms and Lord Taylor. Great for fine gifts and luxery items. Also attached to a movie theatre and several restaurants.
Intriguing jewelry and ceramics a couple blocks south of the East Pilsen galleries, worth a browse even if youre not planning to buy anything.

A fine art gallery displaying the artwork by the owners, Elizabeth and Mike Marks as well as local emerging artists. A wide range of original artwork available to suit everybodys tastes. Paintings, ceramics, jewelery and more.

Fore River Gallery is located at 613 Congress Street in the heart of downtown Portlands Arts District, near the intersection of High Street and Congress Street, diagonally from the Portland Museum of Art.
Main Street Trading Co. sells furniture to give homes an early American period and country feel. The website recommends calling before you arrive at the store.
Monday, Tuesday, Thursday 11:00 - 16:00, Friday, Saturday 11:00 - 17:00, Closed: Wednesday
Delightful browsing in this unique collection of used books, sheet music, comics, etc. This store location is one of a few retail locations of Wonder Book which also sells many books online.
There are a number of art galleries and antique shops in the area: Other local shops include: Yard sales are popular in the summer. Look for roadside signs.
In Shinnston. A family-based business of wood, glass and metal artisans. Classes offered in stained glass, pen turning and basic woodwork.
Alton, Illinois is a shoppers paradise with over 50 antique shops and Alton Square Mall to choose from. Special Third Thursday Shop Til You Drop events are scheduled each fall and winter.
Northcoast Canvas, 250 SE Catawba, 1+ 419-734-5453 Marine upholstery, enclosures, storage and canvas shop.

West Chester is known for its quaint boutiques and trendy shops. Gay street is a central area for shopping. Malenas Vintage boutique, Plane Janea and Niche are just some of the fashionable shops located on Gay Street. The unique finds in Malenas Boutique range from 50s cocktail dresses to Gucci bags. This little store has everything a fashionista would want. Plain Jane sells any type of beauty product a girl could need. This affordable store has jeans and nice button-downs for men along with beautifully, colorful dresses for women. These are just a few of the shopping experiences West Chester has to offer. One place that is frequented by the local kids during the summertime is the Brandywine River. There are plenty of rope swings and little spots to hang out. The rope swings arent really a tourist spot, they are more like a hangout spot for residents of West Chester. The Brandywine River Park is also a popular place for companies and large groups to spend the day. There are also canoe and kayak tours during the spring and summer seasons.

Country Splinters and Stitches, US-19 in Jane Lew, 304-884-8700. Open 8:30 am to 4:30 pm Monday through Friday, and 10 am to 3 pm on Saturday; closed Sundays. Locally-made crafts, including primitives, home decor, handmade clothing and quilts, candles, antiques and Pandora jewelry.
Located in Haley Center on the Auburn University campus. Auburn University souvenirs and supplies.

One of three bookstores in downtown Gig Harbor, No Dearth of Books specializes in unique local interest books: maritime fiction travel accounts, boating know-how, military, naval aviation history, and the Pacific Northwest. The store also stocks a wide range of other genres, from classics to recent bestsellers.

White Flint Mall has lots of art stores to visit. Anthropologie, a womens clothing store, is a unique place, and is located at the intersection of Nicholson Lane and Rockville Pike. One of the best thrift shops in the area is the Goodwill on Boiling Brook Parkway (off of Nicholson Lane), by the Kosher Mart. Asadurs Market featuring Arabic, Persian, and Mediterranean foods and is located on Nicholson Lane in in the shopping center right before the train tracks. Russian Gourmet is located right before the Rockville Pike intersection of Nicholson Lane; Russian food and cultural products. Congressional Shopping Center has lots of privately-owned clothing, baby and jewelry stores.

Hermantown is home to about half of Duluths "Mall Area", so expect to find the usual selection of national and regional chain stores. Ones within Hermantown city boundaries include Wal-Mart, Sams Club, Gander Mountain, Menards, and HOM Furniture. Farther along US-53, the selection becomes more local.

The AGC was started in 2002 and has become a staple of the Charlestown art scene ever since. There are many different types of art offered in this gallery. In addition to the group selling its own art, artists from the community who arent members can display their art. Anything from watercolor paintings to sculptures to photography is on sale at the exhibits. In the spring and summer there is an outdoor festival held at City Square.
A 90 year old fabric store for men and women, with a full two floors and very low prices.

There are several major shopping areas in Lexington. Keep an eye out for merchandise marked " Kentucky Proud ", which marks it as a participant in Kentuckys buy-local initiative. Nicholasville Road, particularly between Man o War Boulevard and New Circle Road, is a major center for shopping, with several malls and many smaller stores. Adjacent Lexington Green strip mall features Victorian Square also connects via pedway to the Lexington Shops in the belly of the Lexington Convention Center, with the Kentucky Proud Market, a UK Memorabilia store, and more. Maxwell/High is streets bordered on the west and north by Maxwell and High streets respectively, containing a myriad of small, primarily youth-oriented independent boutiques as well as several restaurants. Small boutiques includes the Black Market Boutique, Helens Boutique, Lucias, Calypso, Mod Boutique, Johns Walk Run Shop, and ILO. South Lime/Campus Area The bordering downtown campus area features many locally owned restaurants and small locally owned stores. Stop by CD Central for used CDs, new albums, DVDs, wall sized posters, T-shirts from major and local artists, and more. Sqecials features many unique gifts from magazines, eclectic books, jewelry, candles, incense, trinkets, and journals. ReBelle is a one of a kind shop featuring all kinds of yarn, locally made clothes, and jewelry. Kennedy Book Store is one of the oldest locally owned college book stores in Lexington. Features sports memorabilia for all UK fans, souvenirs, and an Art Part that serves artists from all over central Kentucky.

Kayak Rentals are available near the marina, look for a small hand painted sign pointing up a driveway. A small business but they actually have a decent selection of boats available to explore the area.
. Your one stop shop for goth, fetish, punk, industrial and renaissance clothing…if you’re into that sort of thing.
Big screen, color television, antennas and satellite service and sales
Catering to your needs in outdoor clothing, camping supplies, souvenirs, gifts and lifes everyday necessities!
Buffalo Mall, Jamestown, ND 58401 Retail Fabrics
Has products from toys to bird feeders to clothing. Also has many pieces of nature-related artwork and everything else imaginable. Their slogan is: "A Nature Store and a Whole Lot More."
See wine tasting in the Do section.

M-F 10AM-8PM, Sa 9AM-6PM, Su 12PM-5PM. Carries upscale mens clothing. Perfect for finding a tux for the big wedding day or that business suit that makes you feel like a million bucks, without having to spend it. Has a large inventory of shirts, pants and shoes as well. Also has gentlemen’s accessories to complete your look.
Very small grocery with a nice deli.
(Exit 8, I-540) This mall is the primary shopping mall in Fort Smith with shops, restaurants and movies.
Fine arts and fine crafts by local artists, featuring Jewelry, Ceramics, Fiber Art, Photography, Stained Glass, Oil and Watercolor Paintings…and much more!
A number of art galleries and antique shops can be found on Main Street in the historic district, offering a wide range of pieces to suit many tastes.
Tu-Sa 11AM-5PM, Su and M closed. Known for their extensive and retail Italian charm bracelets- available in gold, steel, and silver.
Gift and craft shop located in a cute old home selling Americana arts and crafts.
Downtown Farmers Market, Falls Park. Open every Saturday morning from May-October. Dozens of vendors offering a variety of fresh fruit, vegetables, meats, etc.

The Wyoming Valley Mall is located north of the city, (570) 823-1224, it features JCPenny, The Bon-Ton, Sears, and Macys, among other stores. Check website for directions and full store directory. The Arena Hub Plaza is located across the street from the Mall. It features a sporting goods store, clothing stores, some restaurants, and a Barnes Noble book store. Nearly all of the shops are chain stores located in the mall area outside of downtown. Comic book collectors should check out Gema off Blackman Street, and the Phoenix downtown.

Cedarburgs shops are most well known for jewelry, artwork and antique home furnishings. Known around town for its green clock out front is Armbrusters, a jeweler which has been a fixture of the town for well over a century. Its current location on Washington Avenue was built in 1908. North of Bridge Street Washington Avenue is the Gem Shop, selling rocks and gems from around the world, found by the shops proprietors. The Cedar Creek Settlement, at Bridge Street Washington, offers a variety of shops, and many more are located up and down Washington Avenue, including bookstores, flower shops, jewelers, art galleries, furniture stores, clothing boutiques, and much else. An excellent time to shop in Cedarburg is during one of the many annual festivals, including Winter Fest, Strawberry Fest, German Fest and Wine Harvest Fest. Maxwell Street days at the County Fair Grounds hosts small vendors selling everything from antiques to collectibles, knick-knacks, curios and odds-and-ends.
New Movie Theater with first run movies.

Eureka Books is one of the last classic antiquarian bookstores on the West Coast, offering new, used, and rare books, along with an extraordinary selection of vintage photographs, prints and maps. Located in the heart of Old Town in an elegant Victorian storefront built in 1879, Eureka Books is truly a destination bookstore.
in Old Town across from the gazebo

514 W Commerce. Hours: 10AM-8PM, summer; 10AM-6PM, winter. Stores closed New Year’s Day, Easter, Thanksgiving, and Christmas. Visitors can browse through the 32 shops at "El Mercado," and 80 specialty shops in Farmers Market Plaza. Market Square is also the scene of many Hispanic festivals where food and beverage booths spring up alongside the Guadalajara lamps and the strains of mariachi music blend with the excitement of Mexican dances.

Full-service independent bookstore selling mostly new but some used books. Special orders are welcome and customers are encouraged to browse. Chairs, Free WiFI, Courtyard available. Very active, with author signings, local charity events, poetry readings, etc.

Downtown Holland, listed on the National Register of Historic Places, includes eight blocks of more than 100 shops and restaurants housed in Victorian buildings. The sidewalks are heated by underground hot-water pipes, making shopping a pleasant experience even in winter. Most shops are open until 9PM during the week. Two characteristically Dutch handicrafts can be purchased at the DeKlomp Wooden Shoe and Delft Factory, 12755 Quincy Avenue, the only factory of its kind in the United States. You can watch the artists producing both delftware, a traditional blue-and-white pottery originally produced around the town of Delft in the Netherlands, and wooden shoes, on machines that were imported from the Netherlands.

There are numerous shopping opportunities in Bend. Downtown Bend has all different kinds of shops from outdoor gear to clothes. Secondly, the Old Mill District has great shops including REI, Pac Sun, Victoria’s Secret, American Eagle, Gap and other great stores. Also, a few good restaurants including Anthonys and Red Robin.
Fresh cranberries, carefully harvested from family owned bogs. The cranberry chutney features fresh whole berries and pure maple syrup.
Independently owned card, gift and toy store. Best cards around. Unique gifts. Friendly and helpful staff. Always something new.
The huge Chicagoland location of the legendary outdoor recreation store, with tons of gear for hunting, fishing, and camping.
Groceries, gas, and necessities are not available in Mammoth Spring, but available just over the state line in Thayer, Missouri. Several antique stores and flea markets are located in Mammoth Spring.
A nationally-known shop which crafts fine hand-made custom cowboy boots to order.

Route 522 and Fairfax Street. Open 10 am to 2 pm on Sunday from May through October. Locally grown fresh fruits and vegetables, flowers and vegetable plants, fresh and dried herbs and herbal products, house plants, perennials, fresh meat, dairy products, breads and pastries, james and jellies, honey, fresh eggs, prepared foods, contests and special events.
We invite you to step into comfort at Footprints!
Craft gallery featuring a fine selection of jewellery, pottery and crafts.
The Gallery Shops, 6580 Richmond Road, Williamsburg

Kapalua Resort features an distinct array of shopping experiences for the resort, adventure, sports and casual shopper: Kapalua Logo shop - This store is dedicated to the world-renowned Kapalua butterfly logo on a variety of golf apparel and lifestyle wear, featuring exclusive fashion labels for men, women and children. Island inspired gifts and home décor merchandise are also featured. Located in the Kapalua Resort Center. Kapalua Adventures Outfitters Shop- In the Kapalua Resort Center, youll find a boutique of premium outdoor gear, sportswear, hats, shoes and fun accessories for the adventurous-at-heart. Kapalua Golf and Tennis Garden Pro Shops- For the finest in golf apparel, golf clubs and equipment, visit The Plantation Course Pro Shop and The Bay Course Pro Shop at the Kapalua Golf Courses. Kapalua Tennis Garden offers tennis apparel and gear, tennis racquets and more in its Tennis Pro Shop next to The Bay Course. Honolua Store - In this landmark general store at the heart of the resort, shop for gourmet foods, snacks, soft drinks, juices and groceries along with an impressive selection of beer and wine. Youll also find a charming variety of island and home decor gift items and Kapalua logo souvenirs. La Perle - Located in the Honolua Village Center is a fine jewelry store, featuring exclusive Kapalua butterfly and designer jewelry as well as an exquisite array of Tahitian and South Seas pearls.
Staff is knowledgeable and unstuffy; a service-oriented business with competitive pricing and high quality selection. Free wine tastings every Saturday, 2 - 5PM.

This annual event has become the largest festival in Champaign County. The main course: hot, steaming ears of sweetcorn! The festivities kick off on Friday at 5:00 pm and will last until 11:00 pm as well as all day Saturday from 11:00 am until 11:00 pm. Bring your family and friends, enjoy food, music, and more fun than you can handle. Activities include a petting zoo and pony rides, a rock climbing wall and live entertainment.
Friday August 24 2012 at 5:00 pm and will last until 11:00 pm as well as all day Saturday August 25 2012 from 11:00 am until 11:00 pm.
Browse the dozens of antique stores, shops, and galleries on Main Street.

Providence Coffee Roasters, a local fair trade organic coffee roasting company offers both fresh roasted artisan coffee beans, coffee, and specialty drinks. A bonus is a cafe atmosphere for those that just want to relax with free WIFI. Fresh savory and sweet crepes by La Creperie also a main feature on their over the counter menu.
The downtown Poughkeepsie mall row is a designated National Historic Sight
Open M-Sa 10AM-9PM, Su 12PM-5PM. Major stores in the mall include JC Penney, Elder-Beerman, and Goodys. Also in the mall is a Cinemark Theater.
Dozens of shops, restaurants, and Starplex Luxury Cinemas that cater to all needs. On Friday nights and Saturday nights, the mall can be packed, especially with tweens, and may be best avoided.
Historic district with shopping and restaurants.
W Colorado Ave, between 23rd and 28th Streets

A quaint yet novel record store in the middle of all the hustle of Wakefield, Looney Tunes provides reliable and friendly service that knows just what to do for their customers musical appetite. Be it the latest best-selling CD, or your favorite LP, Looney Tunes is bound to have it for you. If the product you are looking for isnt in stock, you can always have them pre-order it for you online as well. The employees have a very deep appreciation of music of all kinds; you can approach any of them for their opinions on what is commendable, and they are enthusiastic about what they know.
Rt 16 North Conway . An extensive collection of name-brand outlets offering bargains and tax-free shopping!

The main shopping area in Erie is centered around Peach Street, south of the city to its junction with I-90. Many of the typical national chains can be found, many of which are contained in Millcreek Mall, a sprawling single-story mall/strip complex. Smaller niche shopping is available on the west side of the city in plazas on West 8th, 12th, and 26th Streets. The downtown also has a few stores, but has not been a large retail draw since the late 1970s. Erie is a popular shopping destination because of Pennsylvanias waiver of sales tax on clothing. Many people from the surrounding states and Ontario make special trips to Erie for this reason.
The fashion boutique of the Hollywood Tower Hotel has everything for Twilight Zone fans.
at the exit from The Twilight Zone Tower of Terror
Fresh cut and silk flowers, unusual, artistic gift wrap paper, cards and small gifts.

Grandmas Country Store brings a bit of Amish Country to Western Belmont County. They carry a unique gathering of antique and country treasures and many primitive finds. Grandmas offers many handmade and refurbished items including benches, shelves and cupboards. You will find many wonderful gifts that your friends and family will be delighted to receive. The store is filled with pictures, scented candles, primitive dolls, crocks, crocheted doilies, crows, sheep, and home decorations. We invite you to bring your family and friends to Grandmas Country Store. You can check us out on our website, grandmascountrystoreonline.com

Tickets can be bought at ticket offices in the base areas. Food can be bought at the cafeterias or restaurants. There are gift shops at the Main and East villages. A couple of other stores are present in the main village, but not many. For more shopping, head over to Frisco, Vail, Breckenridge, Silverthorne or Dillon. The closest town for shopping is Frisco, and has a Safeway, Walmart, various fast food and diners, a Wells Fargo bank, pharmacy, sports stores and more.

Lucky for anyone with a love of shopping, Block Island is filled with quaint little gift shops: Chapel Sweets, Chapel Street at Weldons Way. Chapel Sweets is a candy store that specializes in fudge and taffy. Island Bound Book Store, Water Street. Featuring many books of Block Island for adults and children. Star Department Store, Water Street. This old fashioned general store has everything any traveler could want. Clothing, candy, and jewelry; this store is a fun filled stop for many visitors to the island.

The entire built-up area of Cherokee is tourist stores, almost all of which sell Indian-themed merchandise. There is a grocery store on the outskirts of town. If you stop at one of these tourist stores, youve pretty much stopped at all of them. One stand-out is the Talking Leaves Native American Bookstore (Highway 441 Highway 19 Intersection) which has a huge inventory of Native American books which would make any university library proud. They also sell clothing and Native American-made jewelry. Bookstore is owned and operated by a Native American woman. If you really want to learn about the Cherokee people and other Native Americans, stop here and buy a few books. All youll get in the tourist shops is cheap trinkets and fudge.
Custom tattoos. Commissioned portraits and prints in art and photography for sale.
M-Th appointment only, F-Su walk in 1PM-9PM
A Williamsburg-style shopping village styled in the heart of Kannapolis.

Who knew that Southern Californias DIY green-thumb mecca was located in Whittier? Knowledgeable gardeners, thats who. The staff here know everything there is to know about, well, gardening. Bring in a leaf from any plant, and theyll identify it. Seriously.
The central business district, encompassing Beekman Avenue and the adjacent portions of Broadway (Route 9), offers restaurants and shops.

Eclectic collection of jewelry, gifts, pottery, books, cards, stationary, party ware and toys for all ages. Create an atmosphere with An array of scented candles, incense and aromatic bath and beauty treatments.
Purveyors of outdoor adventure equipment. Featuring Day Packs, Backpacks, Clothing, Shoes and Gear. Also, Maps, Books and Cleveland National Forest Adventure Passes.
2317 Main Street, P.O. Box 606, Julian, CA 92036
Contrary to the name of the store, Newtonville Books has now moved to Newton Centre--Independent bookstore noted for contemporary fiction, childrens books, and frequent author readings.
Monday to Saturday: 9am to 9pm Sunday: 11am to 7pm

For those who have been camping extensively, one of the first things to look for in Fairbanks is a shower. Practically every laundromat in town also offers showers for between $3 and $7. Most will provide a towel and liquid soap, but be prepared for a quick cleaning as nearly all will utilize timers that turn the water off after only a few minutes. The Red Fox located on 2nd street next to Soapy Smiths has a large collection of furs and leathers. And it has the smell.
/. An exceptional store that carries antiques, collectibles, and the unexpected.
ANICA Native Store limited selection of groceries.

;Exton Mall: 15 minute drive The mall contains a wide variety of shops for everyone and a well balanced food court with large eating areas. Most of the shopping can be completed here for this mall is a large mall with two stories. Pac Sun KB Toys American Eagle A F Habitat These are just a few stores featured here at the mall in Exton, PA. ;King of Prussia Mall: http://www.kingofprussiamall.com less then a 1/2 hour drive 5th biggest mall in the world over 400 stores, restaurants boutiques This mall is huge separated into two different sections which are linked by a cover walkway through the parking lot. The food variety around the are of the mall is spectacular because it contains many restaurants that are hard to find like Cheesecake Factory and Bahama Breeze. There is a wide range of parking surrounding the entire mall and all stores are well staffed waiting to service the guests needs.
Upscale shopping center in northwestern Livonia, includes movie theater
37700 W Six Mile Road, Livonia, MI 48152

Like most college towns, Clemson is home to numerous fan apparel shops along College Avenue. A few to check out are: Judge Kellers, +1-864-654-6446, 367 College Ave The Athletic Department, +1-864-654-1719, 1102 Tiger Blvd
